name: Sanzenri
description:
Right arrow, left arrow. Repeat.

Bashō, legendary haiku poet, described his pilgrimage in Oku No Hosomichi as "sanzenri", an expression coined by author Murasaki Shikibu to mean 'an unimaginable distance'.
Sanzenri translates to 3000ri, a distance of approximately 11700km.
Bashō would walk roughly a fifth of that distance before reaching Ogaki, in the snowy northern prefecture of Mutsu, 155 days after he departed Edo.
